items.message: A flood alert has been issued as a result of high tides, flooding is expected over the next 4 days with tides peaking Thursday evening 22/08/24. Conditions may apply for an hour either side of high tide. Flooding may affect low lying land and roads adjacent the Wye Estuary from Redbrook to Chepstow. Predicted peaks today Tuesday evening 20/08/24:- Newport 7.0m to 7.3m at 20:45. Avonmouth Portbury 7.3m to 7.6m at 20:45.  No thresholds are expected to be crossed on Wednesday mornings tide but they are rising again for Wednesday evening.  We are closely monitoring the situation. Please stay away from large waves as they are dangerous. This message will be updated by 11:00 on Wednesday, 21/08/24, or as the situation changes.

items.description: Wyre estuary from Fleetwood and Knott End to Little Eccleston
items.message:
High tides this evening may lead to flooding. Flooding is possible with the midday tide today, 20/08/2024, but not expected. Further flooding is possible on the overnight tide tonight, 20/08/2024 into tomorrow, 21/08/2024 due to spring tides and strong winds over the next few days. Therefore the flood alert remains in place. Areas most at risk include Tiger's Tail, Wyre Dock, Burrow's Marsh, Burn Naze, Thornton, Trunnah, Stanah, Poulton-le-Fylde, Skippool, Hambleton, Cold Row, Little Singleton, Little Eccleston and Crow Woods. We are closely monitoring the situation.
Take care along promenades, coastal footpaths and roads. This message will be updated by 5:00pm on 20/08/2024 or as the situation changes.

High tides this evening may lead to flooding. Flooding is possible with the midday tide today, 20/08/2024, but not expected. However, further flooding is possible on the overnight tide tonight, 20/08/2024 into tomorrow, 21/08/2024, due to spring tides and strong winds over the next few days. Therefore the flood alert remains in place. Areas most at risk include Coast at North Morecambe Bay from Roosebeck to Carnforth including low lying areas around Ulverston, Greenodd, Haverthwaite, Flookburgh, Grange-over-Sands, Levens, Milnthorpe, Sandside, Arnside and Silverdale. We have closed the flood gates at Arnside promenade, these will remain closed throughout the high tide cycle. Be careful along beaches, promenades, coastal footpaths and roads as large waves and sea spray could be dangerous. This message will be updated by 5:00 PM on 20/08/2024, or as the situation changes.
